pledge: I pledge to prioritize my health and well-being over my addiction, seeking support from loved ones and professionals whenever needed.
I pledge to stay committed to my recovery journey, acknowledging that setbacks may occur but that they are opportunities for growth, not reasons to give up.
I pledge to develop healthy coping mechanisms and alternative activities to replace the void left by my addiction, rediscovering joy and purpose in life.
I pledge to take each day as it comes, focusing on progress rather than perfection, and celebrating even the smallest victories along the way.
I pledge to be honest with myself and others about my struggles and victories, understanding that vulnerability is a strength, not a weakness.
I pledge to surround myself with positive influences and to distance myself from triggers and negative environments that may fuel my addiction.
I pledge to forgive myself for past mistakes and to embrace the journey of self-forgiveness and self-compassion as integral parts of my recovery.
I pledge to educate myself about addiction and its effects, empowering myself with knowledge and understanding to better navigate the challenges ahead.
I pledge to practice self-care and self-love, recognizing that I am worthy of a life free from the shackles of addiction.
I pledge to never give up on myself, knowing that recovery is possible and that I deserve to live a fulfilling and addiction-free life.
